page.title: 19RECREATION IN BEAMINSTER
page.content: Despite the small population and absence of municipal facilities, there is a wide range of entertainment and recreational activities. All you need to give is your time and interest. There are clubs if you wish to sing, dance, act, listen to music, ramble, arrange flowers, photography, learn more about gardening and the arts. Branches of national societies include Cubs, Brownies, Scouts, Guides, Young Farmers, Mother's Union, W.Is., British Legion and Senior Citizens. For friendships abroad there is town twinning; closer to home the Social Club. If you enjoy sport and have a ball, you can kick, bat, bowl or hit it with a a hockey stick. The school facilities allow for swimming, archery, badmington and gymnastics. The pubs offer darts, skittles and pool and excellent cider.
